TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {166255=© 2012 Wharton County Junior College    911 Boling Highway    Wharton, Texas    77488    Tel: (979) 532-4560, 154387=Required Textbook: 978-1-61669-039-7 BLS for Healthcare Providers Student Manual (includes Pocket Reference Card) , 150169=Required Textbook: 978-1-61669-039-7 BLS for Healthcare Providers Student Manual (includes Pocket Reference Card), 7948=Phone: 281-239-1531, 20599=Medical Insurance Billing - The study of the principles and practice of insurance and reimbursement processing, including the assignment and reporting of codes for diagnoses; completion of CMS-1500 claims for outpatient, emergency department, and physician office encounters; and the review of cases to identify issues of fraud and abuse., 46813=Required Materials: 1 GB flash drive  Required Textbook: Microsoft Word 2010 (Level 2) by Logical Operations ISBN: 978-1-4246-1534-6, 36925=Required Materials: 1 GB flash drive Required Textbook: Plain and Simple Office 2010 ISBN: 978-0-7356-2697-3, 39050=Course Description: This course offers fundamental instruction for using the MS Excel 2010 software application. Participants will learn how to set-up spreadsheets, create formulas, basic functions, and how to insert graphs, charts, and clip art., 42349=Required Materials: 1 GB flash drive Required Textbook: Microsoft PowerPoint 2010 (Level 2) by Logical Operations ISBN: 1424615720, 16801=9:00AM-12:00PM, 45940=Course Description: Master the basics of the word processor PC Magazine ranked as one of the "strongest and most intelligent programs ever written." In this hands-on workshop, you'll learn how to add, move through, and edit text; move words from one part of your document to another; work on two or more documents simultaneously; change the size or appearance of text; change margins and tab settings; automatically center, right align, justify, and indent text; run the integrated grammar and spelling checker; use the thesaurus; and save, retrieve, copy, organize, and print your documents. By the time you're done with the step-by-step lessons and hands-on activities in this course, you'll be able to use Word confidently at home or on the job., 100663=**Please note: There will no class on May 25th due to Memorial Day holiday.**, 39418=Required Materials: 1 GB flash drive  Required Textbook: Microsoft Excel 2010 (Level 2) by Logical Operations ISBN: 978-1-4246-1894-1}

textAfterTable: 90062 60031 TR 5:30PM-8:30PM 08/18 - 10/30 ELC 101 $750 Active August 13 by 4:00 PM 60028 60029 MW 9:00AM-12:00PM 09/21 - 12/04 ELC 101 $750 Active September 17 by 4:00PM 60030 70012 MW 5:30PM-8:30PM 09/28 - 12/07 SGL 275 $750 Active September 24 by 4:00PM Course Description: This course provides preparation for entry-level nursing assistants to achieve a level of knowledge, skill, and ability for providing care to residents of long term care facilities. 40 hours of clinical training  are required for completion of the course. Times and dates of clinical rotations will be announced during class. Upon passing the state exam, students will enter the field as a Certified Nurse Aide. Supplies: Textbook, scrubs (top and bottom), stethoscope, watch with second hand, non-skid and non-skid shoes. Students are responsible for the cost of the Certified Nurse Aide state exam. Approximate cost of the exam is approximately $95. Testing will be conducted after successful completion of
